data: Boustrophedon. The inscription runs across the four faces (a, b, c, d) of the block and on the upper edge.
Found in 1883 on proprietà Sanfilippo, Mendolito
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

A superb local collection in an 11th century castle with excellent views of Etna and the plain of Catania. Neolithic and Bronze age material from various sites in the area; 8th-5th century material (indigenous and Greek) principally from Mendolito; 4-2 C BC material (principally ceramic), Roman sculpture, amphorae etc. The upper floors have modern weapons, paintings and letters.
Iscrizioni di Adrano in alfabeto siculo
Giacomo Manganaro, «Iscrizioni di Adrano in alfabeto siculo», Archeologia Classica 13 (1961): 106–12
Per una definizione del materiale epigrafico anellenico di Sicilia
Luciano Agostiniani, «Per una definizione del materiale epigrafico anellenico di Sicilia», Studi Epigrafici 41 (1973): 388–95
Il panorama attuale delle ricerche storico-etimologiche nel dominio italiano

Alberto Zamboni, Il panorama attuale delle ricerche storico-etimologiche nel dominio italiano, Estr. da Annales / Universitatis scientiarum budapestinensis de Rolando Eotvos nominatae. Separatum Sectio linguistica 10 (Budapest, 1978)

R.M. Albanese Procelli, «Mendolito», in Bibliografia topografica della colonizzazione greca in Italia e nelle isole tirreniche, a c. di G. Nenci e G. Vallet, vol. 9 (Pisa: Scuola Normale Superiore, 1991), 545–61
Le iscrizioni anelleniche del Museo di Adrano
Luciano Agostiniani, «Le iscrizioni anelleniche del Museo di Adrano», in Tra Etna e Simeto. La ricerca archeologica ad Adrano e nel suo territorio (Catania, 2009), 115–18
Luigi Bernabò Brea, il Museo di Adrano e gli inizi degli scavi al Mendolito

Paola Pelagatti, «Luigi Bernabò Brea, il Museo di Adrano e gli inizi degli scavi al Mendolito», in Tra Etna e Simeto. La ricerca archeologica ad Adrano e nel suo territorio (Catania: Biblioteca della Provincia Regionale di Catania, 2009), 16–26
Dall’alfabetizzazione alla permeabilità selettiva. Per una proposta di lettura della documentazione epigrafica del Mendolito

Valentina Mignosa, ‘Dall’alfabetizzazione Alla Permeabilità Selettiva. Per Una Proposta Di Lettura Della Documentazione Epigrafica Del Mendolito’, Incontri Di Filologia Classica 17 (2018 2017): 215–42
Manganaro, 1961, Iscrizioni di Adrano in alfabeto siculo
Schmoll, 1968, Neues zu den protosizilischen Inschriften
Agostiniani, 1973, Per una definizione del materiale epigrafico anellenico di Sicilia
Zamboni, 1978, Il panorama attuale delle ricerche storico-etimologiche nel dominio italiano
Agostiniani, 2009, Le iscrizioni anelleniche del Museo di Adrano

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Manganaro 1961

translation

commentary

The document is the so-called 'cippo Sanfilippo' (from the surname of the owner of the land where it was found), a lava stone parallelepiped, discovered in 1883, interpreted as a terminus and datable to the 6th century BCE. The cippus, previously kept in the Villa Sanfilippo, was donated in 1960 to the Museo Archeologico Etneo in Adrano, where it is now located. The text is difficult to read due to the poor state of conservation of the stone. However, it is clear that the text is boustrophedon and presents, as far as can be read, the alphabet typical of Sikel inscriptions from the Etna area. Worthy of note, in particular, is the presence of the arrow-shaped alpha, the digamma (with value of v, see also ISic003364).

commentary

The document is the so-called 'cippo Sanfilippo' (from the surname of the owner of the land where it was found), a lava stone parallelepiped, discovered in 1883, interpreted as a terminus and datable to the 6th century BCE. The cippus, previously kept in the Villa Sanfilippo, was donated in 1960 to the Museo Archeologico Etneo in Adrano, where it is now located. The text is difficult to read due to the poor state of conservation of the stone. However, it is clear that the text is boustrophedon and presents, as far as can be read, the alphabet typical of Sikel inscriptions from the Etna area. Worthy of note, in particular, is the presence of the arrow-shaped alpha, the digamma (with value of v, see also ISic003364).

ΜΟΓΟΜ ΣΙΕΛΔΟ ΜΟΙΔΑ
ΝΑΔΑΡΑ ΚΟΙΤΟΒ ϜͰΕΛͰΟ
ΡΟΓΑΥ ΛΤΙΝΑΣ ϜΟΓ
ΠΙΣΕΜΒ ΡΟϜΑΣΔΙΣ ϜΣΑΙΟ
mogom sieldo moida
nadara koitob vhelho
rogau ltinas vog
pisemb rovasdis vsaio
Text after Manganaro 1961

The document is the so-called 'cippo Sanfilippo' (from the surname of the owner of the land where it was found), a lava stone parallelepiped, discovered in 1883, interpreted as a terminus and datable to the 6th century BCE. The cippus, previously kept in the Villa Sanfilippo, was donated in 1960 to the Museo Archeologico Etneo in Adrano, where it is now located. The text is difficult to read due to the poor state of conservation of the stone. However, it is clear that the text is boustrophedon and presents, as far as can be read, the alphabet typical of Sikel inscriptions from the Etna area. Worthy of note, in particular, is the presence of the arrow-shaped alpha, the digamma (with value of v, see also ISic003364).
